question: when was the cat and mouse act introduced
chain_of_thought_result: The Cat and Mouse Act was introduced in the United Kingdom in 1913. This legislation was officially known as the Prisoners (Temporary Discharge for Ill Health) Act 1913. It was designed to address the hunger strikes of suffragettes, allowing for the temporary release of prisoners who were on hunger strikes due to ill health, only to be re-arrested once they recovered.
